thread.title: Northwestern girls fight pressure more than foes for fifth straight CL cross country title
thread.title_full: Northwestern girls fight pressure more than foes for fifth straight CL cross country title

title: Northwestern girls fight pressure more than foes for fifth straight CL cross country title
text:
Complete Box Score » 
For Abigail Smith , her Northwestern Lehigh team’s winning the Colonial League girls cross country championship made for almost more of a salvation than a triumph. 
“It’s like having a weight lifted off your shoulders,’’ said Smith after the Tigers saw seven of their runners finish in the top 17 spots in Thursday’s league meet at DeSales University to claim their fifth consecutive league crown. “It’s a huge relief, too. We could really feel the pressure hanging on us.” 
The Tigers entered the meet 24-0 on the dual meet and as overwhelming favorites. The final score wasn’t especially close; Northwestern totaled 36 points to runner-up Wilson’s 74 and Saucon Valley’s 84. 
And yet Northwestern, which was led by sophomore Molly Tarvin (second, 20 minutes and 13 seconds) and freshman Madeline Consuelos (third, 20:18) was worried. 
“We have to pay attention to every little thing that we have to do and we don’t take anything for granted or overlook anyone,” said Smith, who finished fourth on the Tiger ladder and ninth overall at 21:22. “Winning this meet is what we have been working for all season. We have a great tradition and we want to carry it on.” 
Of course it may be precisely that kind of attention to detail and dedication to excellence that keeps Northwestern on top. 
“Every year we have older girls on the team who have won before and then pass that on to the younger girls,” Smith said. “They want us to keep the winning attitude and to keep working hard. We don’t know any other way but to race all together (their spread between 1 and 5 Wednesday was 1:19) and it’s a good way to help the younger runners along.” 
And it’s a proven winning formula – even if all the winning comes with a pressure of its own. 
Brad Wilson may be reached at bwilson@lehighvalleylive.com . Follow him on Twitter @bradwsports . Find Lehigh Valley high school sports on Facebook .
